page.title: 05CONSERVATION ON THE COMMON
page.content: People have been very concernd because new houses might be built.If the new houses are built the common will be destroyed.The Council for the Protection of Rural England is particularly worried that the common land and natural habitats,will be lost.However the mini-town planers have said they want to preserve Savages Wood,Sherbourne's Brake,Webbs Wood and Stoke Brook which are major uncultivated areas.A conservation group in our area called Avon Wildlife Trust is working to protect the land.Young people can join the Watch club,the junior section of the Trust,but it does not yet have a large group in the area.
